First, what is sampling bias? From what I remember, it's when the sample you choose isn't representative of the entire population, leading to incorrect conclusions. So, the hospital might have a biased sample if the patients surveyed aren't similar to all patients.

Why might this sampling method introduce bias? Well, they're only surveying during weekdays, specifically mornings. That means they're missing patients who visit on weekends or in the afternoons or evenings. Maybe patients who come on weekends are different from those who come during the week. So, the hospital might think satisfaction is higher than it really is because they didn't survey people who might have lower satisfaction, like those who come on weekends or later in the day.

So, the sampling bias is that the hospital only surveyed a subset of patients (weekday mornings), which might not represent the entire patient population.
